document.masterDocTitle: A new apterous species of Platypalpus Macquart (Diptera: Hybotidae, Tachydromiinae) from Ecuador

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A new apterous species of Platypalpus Macquart (Diptera: Hybotidae, Tachydromiinae) from Ecuador

subSubSection.paragraph: Diagnosis. Small, black wingless species. Head set very close to thorax. Two pairs of distinct vertical bristles, mesonotum as long as wide, scutellum very small. Fore and mid femora thickened, mid femur bearing 3 strong anterior apical bristles aligned, 2 ventral rows of numerous black, short and strong spines and a row of 7 long posteroventral bristles. Mid tibia with short acute apical projection (spur).
Etymology. From the Greek, “ a ” = negative prefix, “pterus” = wings, the specific epithets apterus refers to “the one who has no wings”.
